page.title: 04GARNONS HOME FARM
page.content: GARNONS HOME FARM, STAUNTON ON WYE Between 1956 & 1983, mainly as a reaction to the anti-landlord legislation the farm grew from 450 - 1800 acres taking in five tenanted farms. About 1/3 is permanent pasture or long leys and 2/3 in a 4 year all arable rotation. There is a breeding flock of 1500 Welsh half-bred ewes crossed with a Suffolk ram for fat lambs, and a commercial herd of 100 cross bred cows crossed with Blond d'Aquitaine bull. The arable rotation is wheat/barley, oats, wheat, broken by sugar beet 120a, beans 50a oilseed rape 60a. To complete the break 40 acres are let to a neighbouring farmer to grow sprouts and 60 acres to another to grow potatoes.
